intro: Habenella santa-martae, commonly known as the Santa Marta habenula, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking, often colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in the humid climate. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in spikes, displaying shades of red and orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
